wikipedia_page.main:
His Hon. Henry Yorke Stanger (11 November 1849 – 19 April 1929), was a British Liberal Party politician and judge.
He was born in Nottingham, the third son of George Eaton Stanger and Mary Hurst. He was educated at Lincoln College, Oxford (Scholar); Tancred Law Student; 2nd class Classical Moderations; 1st class Greats. He married in 1880, Henrietta Sophia Wastie Green. They had one son and two daughters.

response: * Henry Yorke Stanger (1849-1929), English politician and judge

In October 1900 Mrs A Urmston of the Leigh Co-operative Women's Guild,Leigh Cooperative Women's Guild Monthly Reports. Wigan Archives Leigh Town Hall. wrote to Leigh's MP, C. P. Scott asking him to vote favourably on Women's Suffrage Bills. He answered in the affirmative.Guardian Archive, Women's Suffrage collection GDN/123/54 and 55 Archive + Manchester In 1908 Henry Yorke Stanger, Leigh County Court Judge and MP for Kensington North, introduced a private member's Women's Suffrage Bill.Hansard February 1908 on lineLeigh Journal 2 September 1910
